Paragraph: A thin layer ( 40-50 nm ) of PEDOT : PSS was spin - coated onto silicon substrates , and the pristine polymer or the blended thin films were produced by spin - coating on top of the PEDOT : PSS layer.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PEDOT |
| PSS |
| Silicon |
| Polymer |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with the valid entities:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PEDOT |
| PSS |

The entities "silicon" and "polymer" are not specific material names, but rather a generic term and a class of materials, respectively. Therefore, they are not included in the table.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: A thin layer ( 40-50 nm ) of PEDOT : PSS was spin - coated onto silicon substrates , and the pristine polymer or the blended thin films were produced by spin - coating on top of the PEDOT : PSS layer.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PEDOT |
| PSS |
| silicon substrates |
| pristine polymer |
| blended thin films |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PEDOT |
| PSS |

The following entities do not clearly refer to "Material property":

* "thin layer" (is a description of the thickness of the layer, not a material property)
* "silicon substrates" (is a reference to the substrate material, not a property of the material itself)
* "pristine polymer" (is a description of the state of the polymer, not a material property)
* "blended thin films" (is a description of the material composition, not a property of the material itself)

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: A thin layer ( 40-50 nm ) of PEDOT : PSS was spin - coated onto silicon substrates , and the pristine polymer or the blended thin films were produced by spin - coating on top of the PEDOT : PSS layer.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 40-50 nm | Thickness of PEDOT:PSS layer |
| PEDOT:PSS | Material of PEDOT:PSS layer |
| Silicon | Material of substrate |
| Pristine polymer | Material of blended thin films |
| Blended thin films | Material of blended thin films |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 40-50 nm | Thickness of PEDOT:PSS layer |
| PEDOT:PSS | Material of PEDOT:PSS layer |

The following entities do not clearly refer to "Value of material property":

* "Silicon" (material of substrate)
* "Pristine polymer" (material of blended thin films)
* "Blended thin films" (material of blended thin films)

The table above only includes entities that clearly refer to the value of a material property, which are the thickness of the PEDOT:PSS layer and the material of the PEDOT:PSS layer.
